title: Department of Electronics and Communication Engineering
bannerCon: Developing strong foundations in electronic circuits, communication networks, and applied research.

items.subTitle: Overview
items.contents: The department of Electronics and Communication Engineering was established in the year 2009. The research specializations of the department are VLSI Design, Wireless Communications, Embedded Systems, Robotics, Digital image processing, Neural network, Human machine interface, Digital signal Processing.Our department has a very good infrastructure for pursuing R & D in the areas of embedded system design, VLSI design using cadence and Bio signal & Image processing. We also have specialized labs like Embedded systems lab sponsored by Texas Instruments, Fully fledged Cadence Lab for VLSI design and development of products on Low power, and area and also a Bio signal processing lab. Our department has recognized as DELL EMC centre of Academic Excellence Data Science and Big Data Analytics by ICT Academy. The department faculty members has filed Patents and applied funding proposal for SERB, DST.

items.subTitle: Vision
content: To transform the students into industry ready technocrats and instill research in the minds of the young graduates to serve the society.

items.subTitle: Mission
content: To empower the students with enriched skills in the field of Electronics and Communication Engineering and also promote research by providing an excellent academic environment, inculcating values of discipline and dedication to serve the society.

basic.title: Faculty
basic.description: The faculty of the Department of Electronics and Communication Engineering brings expertise in communication systems, signal processing, and embedded technologies. With a focus on design-oriented learning and emerging communication platforms, the faculty equips students to innovate in areas such as wireless networks, VLSI, and smart communication solutions.

tabContent.title: Best Five Papers Faculty wise:
tabContent.subtitle: Paper publications by the Faculty Members

content: Dr. S. Malathy, Professor, ECE Department, Revolutionising AI Deployment: Survey on Hardware Acceleration for Machine Learning Optimisation and Resilience, Communications on Applied Nonlinear Analysis, Vol. 31, No. 4s, pp. 329–340, Scopus, 2024.

Dr. S. Malathy, Professor, ECE Department, Analysis of Revolutionizing Deep Space Optical Communication Networks with AI Advancements, Communications on Applied Nonlinear Analysis, Vol. 31, pp. 177–192, Scopus, 2024.

Dr. S. Ashok Kumar, Associate Professor, ECE Department, Investigation of Charge Plasma based Nanowire Field Effect Transistor for Sub 5 nm, IETE Journal of Research, Taylor & Francis, SCI, Impact Factor: 1.5, January 2024. DOI: 10.1080/03772063.2024.2309227.

Dr. S. Esakki Rajavel, Assistant Professor, Efficient video compression using HEVC and non-linear convolutional Mobile VNet based rate-distortion optimization, ICTACT Journal on Image and Video Processing, Vol. 14, Issue 4, May 2024, UGC Care.
Dr. S. Esakki Rajavel, Assistant Professor, RF Power Amplifier Design Technique for 5G Wireless Communication Systems, ICTACT Journal on Microelectronics, Vol. 10, Issue 1, April 2024, UGC Care.

Dr. S. Esakki Rajavel, Assistant Professor, IoT-Enabled Landslide Monitoring System using LoRa Technology, International Journal of Advanced Research Trends in Engineering and Technology, Vol. 11, Issue 8, pp. 1–7, 2024.

Dr. S. Esakki Rajavel, Assistant Professor, Design of Monopole Circular Patch Antenna Based on DGS for UWB Applications, Antennas for Industrial and Medical Applications, Taylor & Francis, Chapter 2, 2024.

Dr. S. Esakki Rajavel, Assistant Professor, Attention Based Fused CNN for the Early Prediction of Gastrointestinal Disease, SSRG International Journal of Electronics and Communication Engineering, Vol. 11, Issue 8, pp. 301–311, Scopus, 2024.

Ms. M. Ramya, Assistant Professor, Gastric cancer classification in saliva data samples, Journal of Experimental & Theoretical Artificial Intelligence, Taylor & Francis, SCI, Impact Factor: 2.2, January 2024. DOI: https://doi.org/10.1080/0952813X.2023.2301371.

Ms. N. Abirami, Assistant Professor, Analysis of Revolutionizing Deep Space Optical Communication Networks with AI Advancements, Communications on Applied Nonlinear Analysis, Vol. 31, pp. 177–192, Scopus, 2024.
Ms. S. Priyatharsini, Assistant Professor, Autonomous Firefighting Robot for Detection and Prevention, International Research Journal of Multidisciplinary Scope, Vol. 5, pp. 969–976, Scopus, 2024.
